bull.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an adult male animal of the cattle family
bull.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: a herd of cows with one bull
bull.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the male of some other large animals such as the elephant or whale
bull.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: nonsense or something that is completely untrue
bull.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: an official statement from the Pope
bull.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the centre of a target that you are shooting at
bull.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: someone who buys shares because they expect prices to rise
bull.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used to say that you do not believe or agree with what someone has said
bull.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Bull! Where did you get that idea?
bull.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: someone who thinks that prices of shares, bonds, currencies, etc are going to rise, and who will therefore keep and buy investments
bull.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Bulls predict the Dow Jones will go beyond 13,000.
A growing group of dollar bulls (=people who think the price of the dollar is going to rise) has kept the dollar on a firm footing.
